verses.text:
Yahweh is my strength and my fortress,
    my refuge in times of trouble.
    Nations come to you from the most distant parts of the world
    and say, “Our ancestors have inherited lies,
        worthless and unprofitable gods.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“People can’t make gods for themselves.
    They aren’t really gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is what I will teach them.
    This time I will make my power and my strength known to them.
        Then they will know that my name is Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord says, “Judah’s sin is written with an iron pen.
    It is engraved with a diamond point
        on the tablet of their hearts and on the horns of their altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even their children remember their altars
    and their poles dedicated to the goddess Asherah
        beside large trees on high hills
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and on mountains in the open country.
    I will turn your wealth and all your treasures into loot.
    I will do this because of your worship sites and your sin
    throughout all your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will lose the inheritance that I gave you.
    I will make you serve your enemies in a land that you haven’t heard of.
    I will do this because you have stirred up the fire of my anger.
    It will burn forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what Yahweh says:
Cursed is the person who trusts humans,
    who makes flesh and blood his strength
        and whose heart turns away from Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be like a bush in the wilderness.
    He will not see when something good comes.
    He will live in the dry places in the desert,
    in a salty land where no one can live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the person who trusts Yahweh.
    Yahweh will be his confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will be like a tree that is planted by water.
    It will send its roots down to a stream.
    It will not be afraid in the heat of summer.
        Its leaves will turn green.
    It will not be anxious during droughts.
        It will not stop producing fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The human mind is the most deceitful of all things. It is incurable.
    No one can understand how deceitful it is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I, Yahweh, search minds and test hearts.
    I will reward each person for what he has done.
    I will reward him for the results of his actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A person who gets rich dishonestly is like a partridge
    that hatches eggs it did not lay.
        During his lifetime, he will lose his wealth.
            In the end, he will be a godless fool.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our holy place is a glorious throne,
    highly honored from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, the Miqweh Yisrael, all who abandon you will be put to shame.
    Those who turn away from you will be written in dust,
        because they abandon Yahweh,
            the fountain of life-giving water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Heal me, O Yahweh, and I will be healed.
    Rescue me, and I will be rescued.
        You are the one I praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People keep asking me,
    “Where is the word of Yahweh?
        Let it come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not run away from being your shepherd,
    and I have not longed for the day of destruction.
        You know what came out of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not terrorize me.
    You are my refuge on the day of disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put my persecutors to shame,
    but do not let me be put to shame.
    Terrify them,
    but do not let me be terrified.
    Bring the day of disaster on them,
    and destroy them completely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh said to me: Stand at People’s Gate, where the kings of Judah go in and out. Then stand at every gate in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell everyone: “Listen to the word of Yahweh, you kings of Judah, all the people of Judah, and all those who live in Jerusalem, and go through these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: Watch out! If you value your lives, do not carry anything on the day of worship or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not bring anything out of your homes on the day of worship. Do not do any work, but observe the day of worship as a holy day, as I told your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ancestors did not obey me or pay attention to me. They were impossible to deal with and would not listen or accept discipline.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now,” declares Yahweh, “you must listen to me and not bring anything through the gates of this city on the day of worship. You must observe the day of worship as a holy day by not doing any work on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do this, then the kings and princes who sit on David’s throne will come through the gates of this city. They and their princes will ride in chariots and on horses along with the people of Judah and those who live in Jerusalem. This city will always have people living in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “People will come from the cities of Judah, from all around Jerusalem, from the territory of Benjamin, from the foothills, from the mountains, and from the Negev. They will bring burnt offerings, sacrifices, grain offerings, and incense. They will also bring thank offerings to Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you must listen to me and observe the day of worship as a holy day by not carrying anything through the gates of Jerusalem on the day of worship. If you don’t do this, I will set its gates on fire. The fire will burn down the palaces in Jerusalem, and you won’t be able to put it out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go to the potter’s house. There I will give you my message.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I went to the potter’s house, and he was working there at his wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever a clay pot he was working on was ruined, he would rework it into a new clay pot the way he wanted to make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to me. Yahweh asked,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Nation of Israel, can’t I do with you as this potter does with clay? Nation of Israel, you are like the clay in the potter’s hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At one time I may threaten to tear up, break down, and destroy a nation or a kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But suppose the nation that I threatened turns away from doing wrong. Then I will change my plans about the disaster I planned to do to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At another time I may promise to build and plant a nation or a kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But suppose that nation does what I consider evil and doesn’t obey me. Then I will change my plans about the good that I promised to do to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now say to the people of Judah and to those who live in Jerusalem, ‘This is what Yahweh says: I’m going to prepare a disaster and make plans against you. Turn from your evil ways, change your lives, and do good.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But they will answer, ‘It’s useless! We’ll live the way we want to. We’ll go our own stubborn, evil ways.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what Yahweh says:
Ask among the nations if anyone has ever heard anything like this.
    The people of Israel have done a very horrible thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rocky slopes of Lebanon are never without snow.
    The cool mountain streams never dry up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But my people have forgotten me.
    They burn incense as an offering to worthless idols,
        and they stumble along the way, on the ancient path.
        They go on side roads and not on major highways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their land will become desolate
    and something to be hissed at forever.
    Everyone who will pass by it will be stunned and shake his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the east wind I will scatter them in front of the enemy.
    On the day of their disaster,
    I will show them my back, not my face.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Let’s plot against Jeremiah, because the teachings of the priests, the advice of wise people, and the word of the prophets won’t disappear. Accuse him! Pay no attention to anything he says.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay attention to me, O Yahweh,
    and listen to what my accusers say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good should not be paid back with evil.
    They dig a pit to take my life.
        Remember how I stood in your presence and pleaded for them
            in order to turn your anger away from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now, hand their children over to famine.
    Pour out their blood by using your sword.
        Then their wives will become childless widows.
            Their husbands will be put to death.
            Their young men will be struck down in battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make them cry out from their homes
    when you suddenly send troops against them,
        because they dug a pit to catch me and hid snares for my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Yahweh, know that they plan to kill me.
    Don’t forgive their crimes.
    Don’t wipe their sins out of your sight.
        Make them stumble in your presence.
            Deal with them when you get angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: Go and buy a clay jar from a potter. Take along some of the leaders of the people and some of the leaders of the priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the valley of Ben Hinnom at the entrance to Potsherd Gate. Announce there the things I plan to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say, “Listen to the word of Yahweh, you kings of Judah and those who live in Jerusalem. This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: I’m going to bring such a disaster on this place that the ears of everyone who hears about it will ring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The people, their ancestors, and the kings of Judah have abandoned me. They have made this place unrecognizable by burning incense as an offering to other gods that they hadn’t heard of. They have filled this place with the blood of innocent people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have built worship sites to burn their children as sacrifices to Baal. I didn’t ask them or command them to do this. It never entered my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That is why the days are coming, declares Yahweh, when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the valley of Ben Hinnom. Instead, it will be called Slaughter Valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will smash the plans of Judah and Jerusalem in this place. I will cut them down with swords in front of their enemies and with the hands of those who want to kill them. I will give their bodies as food to birds and to animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will devastate this city. It will become something to hiss at. Everyone who goes by it will be stunned and hiss with contempt at all the disasters that happen to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make the people eat the flesh of their sons and daughters. They will eat each other’s flesh during blockades and hardships that their enemies impose on them when they want to kill them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Then smash the jar in front of the men who went with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth says: I will smash these people and this city as this potter’s jar was smashed beyond repair. They will bury the dead in Topheth until there’s no other place to bury them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s what I will do to this place and to those who live in it, declares Yahweh. I will make this city like Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses in Jerusalem, the houses of the kings of Judah, and all the rooftops of the houses will be unclean like this city Topheth. This is because people burned incense to the entire army of heaven and poured out wine offerings to other gods.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah left Topheth, where Yahweh had sent him to prophesy. He stood in the courtyard of Yahweh’s temple and said to all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: I’m going to bring on this city and on all its towns the disasters that I threatened. They’ve become impossible to deal with, and they refuse to obey me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the priest, Immer’s son Pashhur, the chief officer of Yahweh’s temple, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pashhur struck the prophet Jeremiah and put him in prison at Upper Benjamin Gate that was in Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day when Pashhur took Jeremiah out of prison, Jeremiah said to him, “Yahweh doesn’t call you Pashhur, but he calls you Terror Everywhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: I’m going to make you terrify yourself and all your friends. Their enemies’ swords will kill them, and you will see it with your own eyes. I will hand all of Judah over to the king of Babylon. He will take the people away as captives to Babylon or kill them with swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hand all the riches of this city over to their enemies. This will include all its produce, all its valuables, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah. Their enemies will loot them, take them away, and bring them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Pashhur, and all those who live in your house will go into captivity. You will go to Babylon, and you will die there. You will be buried there together with all your friends to whom you prophesied these lies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Yahweh, you have deceived me, and I was deceived.
    You overpowered me and won.
        I’ve been made fun of all day long.
            Everyone mocks me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each time I speak, I have to cry out and shout,
    “Violence and destruction!”
    The word of Yahweh has made me the object of insults
    and contempt all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I think to myself, “I can forget Yahweh
    and no longer speak his name.”
    But his word is inside me like a burning fire shut up in my bones.
    I wear myself out holding it in, but I can’t do it any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard many people whispering,
    “Terror is everywhere!
        Report him! Let’s report him!”
    All my closest friends are waiting to see me stumble.
    They say, “Maybe he will be tricked.
        Then we can overpower him and take revenge on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Yahweh is on my side like a terrifying warrior.
    That is why those who persecute me will stumble. They can’t win.
        They will be very ashamed that they can’t succeed.
            Their eternal shame will not be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Yahweh Tsebaoth examines the righteous.
    He sees their motives and thoughts.
    I want to see you take revenge on them,
    because I’ve brought my case to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to Yahweh! Praise Yahweh!
    He has rescued the lives of needy people
        from the power of wicked people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed is the day that I was born,
    the day that my mother gave birth to me.
        May it not be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed is the man who made my father very happy with the news
    that he had just become the father of a baby boy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May that man be like the cities
    that Yahweh destroyed without pity.
    May he hear a cry of alarm in the morning
    and a battle cry at noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If only he had killed me while I was in the womb.
    Then my mother would have been my grave,
        and she would have always been pregnant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did I come out of the womb?
    All I’ve seen is trouble and grief.
        I will finish my days in shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah when King Zedekiah sent Pashhur, son of Malchiah, and the priest Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah, to Jeremiah. They said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Consult Yahweh for us, because King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon is attacking us. Maybe Yahweh will perform miracles for us so that Nebuchadnezzar will retreat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah responded to them, “This is what you should say to Zedekiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what Yahweh Elohim of Israel says: I’m going to take your weapons away from you. You are using these weapons to fight the king of Babylon as well as the Babylonians who are now blockading you outside the wall. I will bring the Babylonians inside this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will fight you in anger, fury, and rage with my powerful hand and my mighty arm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will defeat those who live in this city, both people and animals. They will die from a terrible plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards, declares Yahweh, I will hand over Judah’s King Zedekiah, his officials, the people, and everyone else in this city who survives the plague, war, and famine. They will be handed over to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and to their enemies who want to kill them. Nebuchadnezzar will kill them with swords. He won’t spare them, show them compassion, or care for them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to these people, ‘This is what Yahweh says: I am going to give you the choice of life or death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who live in this city will die in the war, famine, or plague. Those of you who go out and surrender to the Babylonians will live. You will escape with your lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’ve decided to harm this city, not to do good to it, declares Yahweh. It will be handed over to the king of Babylon, and he will burn it down.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the nation of the king of Judah, ‘Listen to the word of Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
descendants of David. This is what Yahweh says:
Judge fairly every morning.
    Rescue those who have been robbed from those who oppress them.
        Otherwise, my fury will break out and burn like fire.
            No one will be able to put it out
                because of the evil things you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘I’m against you, Jerusalem.
    You are the city that is in the valley
        and on the rock in the plain,’”
            declares Yahweh.
    “‘But you ask, “Who can attack us?
    Who can enter our places of refuge?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘I will punish you because of the evil things you have done,’”
    declares Yahweh.
    “‘I will start a fire in your forests,
    and it will burn up everything around you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: Go to the palace of the king of Judah, and speak this message there:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Listen to the word of Yahweh, you officials, you people who come into these gates, and you, king of Judah, the one sitting on David’s throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Yahweh says: Judge fairly, and do what is right. Rescue those who have been robbed from those who oppress them. Don’t mistreat foreigners, orphans, or widows, and don’t oppress them. Don’t kill innocent people in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do what I say, then the kings who sit on David’s throne will ride through the gates of this palace in chariots and on horses along with their officials and their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you don’t do what I say, I will take an oath on myself,” declares Yahweh, “that this palace will become a pile of rubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what Yahweh says about the palace of the king of Judah:
This palace is like Gilead to me,
    like the top of Lebanon.
    I will certainly turn it into a desert,
    into cities that no one lives in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will send people to destroy you.
    They will have their own weapons.
    They will cut down your finest cedar trees
        and throw them on a fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “People from many nations will pass by this city and ask each other, ‘Why has Yahweh done this to this important city?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The answer will be: ‘They rejected the promise of Yahweh their Elohim. They worshiped other gods and served them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Don’t cry for the dead.
    Don’t shake your heads at them.
    Cry bitterly for those who are taken away,
        because they won’t come back to see their homeland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says about King Josiah’s son Shallum, who succeeded his father as king of Judah and left this place: He will never come back here again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will die in the place where he was taken captive, and he will never see this land again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How horrible it will be for the person who builds his house dishonestly
    and his upper rooms through injustice.
        He makes his neighbors work for nothing
            and doesn’t pay them for their work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He says, ‘I will build a large house for myself with big upper rooms.’
    He cuts out windows in it,
        panels the rooms with cedar,
            and paints them red.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you think you’re a better king than others
    because you use more cedar?
    Your father ate and drank and did what is fair and right.
    Everything went well for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He defended the cause of the poor and needy.
    Everything went well for him.
    Isn’t this what it means to know me?” asks Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But your eyes and your mind are set on nothing but dishonest profits.
    You kill innocent people and violently oppress your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says about Jehoiakim, son of Judah’s King Josiah:
People won’t mourn for him and say,
    “How horrible it is for my brother and sister!”
    They won’t mourn for him and say,
    “How horrible it is for my master and his splendor!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will receive a donkey’s burial.
    He will be dragged off and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go to Lebanon and cry! Raise your voice in Bashan!
    Cry out from Abarim, because all your lovers are defeated.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I spoke to you when you were prosperous,
    but you said that you wouldn’t listen.
    This is how you’ve been ever since you were young.
    You don’t listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wind will blow away all your shepherds,
    and your lovers will go into captivity.
    Then you will be ashamed and disgraced by all your wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You live in Lebanon and have your nest in the cedars.
    But you will groan when pain strikes you,
    pain like a woman giving birth to a child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” declares Yahweh, “even though you, Jehoiakin, son of Judah’s King Jehoiakim, are the signet ring on my right hand, I will pull you off my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hand you over to those who want to kill you, those you fear—King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon and the Babylonians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will throw you and your mother into another land. You weren’t born there, but you will die there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will want to return to this land, but you won’t be allowed to come home.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This Jehoiakin is like a rejected and broken pot that no one wants.
    Is that why he and his descendants will be thrown out
        and cast into another land they’ve never heard of?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O land, land, land!
    Listen to the word of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
Write this about Jehoiakin: He will be childless.
    He won’t prosper in his lifetime.
        None of his descendants will succeed him as king.
            They won’t sit on David’s throne and rule Judah again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How horrible it will be for the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep in my care,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what I, Yahweh Elohim of Israel, said to the shepherds who take care of my people: You have scattered my sheep and chased them away. You have not taken care of them, so now I will take care of you by punishing you for the evil you have done,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I will gather the remaining part of my flock from all the countries where I chased them. I will bring them back to their pasture, and they will be fertile and increase in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will put shepherds over them. Those shepherds will take care of them. My sheep will no longer be afraid or terrified, and not one of them will be missing,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The days are coming,” declares Yahweh,
    “when I will grow a righteous Tsemach for David.
        He will be a king who will rule wisely.
            He will do what is fair and right in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his lifetime, Judah will be saved,
    and Israel will live in safety.
    This is the name that he will be given:
    Yahweh Tsidqenu.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That is why the days are coming,” declares Yahweh, “when people’s oaths will no longer be, ‘Yahweh brought the people of Israel out of Egypt. As Yahweh lives. . . .’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, their oaths will be, ‘Yahweh brought the descendants of the nation of Israel out of the land of the north and all the lands where he had scattered them. As Yahweh lives. . . .’ At that time they will live in their own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Say this about the prophets:
I am deeply disturbed.
    All my bones tremble.
    I am like a drunk,
    like a person who has had too much wine,
        because of Yahweh and his holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land is filled with adulterers.
    The land mourns because of the curse.
    Pastures in the wilderness have dried up.
        The people are evil,
            and they use their strength to do the wrong things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prophets and priests are godless.
    Even in my temple I’ve found them doing evil,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“That is why their own way will become
    like slippery paths in the dark.
    They will be chased away, and they will fall down in the dark.
    I will bring disaster on them.
        It is time for them to be punished,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Say this about the prophets of Samaria:
I saw something disgusting.
    The prophets of Samaria prophesied by Baal
        and led my people Israel astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Say this about the prophets of Jerusalem:
I see something horrible.
    The prophets of Jerusalem commit adultery and live a lie.
        They support those who do evil
            so that no one turns back from his wickedness.
        They are all like Sodom to me,
            and those who live in Jerusalem are like Gomorrah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth says about the prophets:
I will give them wormwood to eat and poison to drink.
    The prophets of Jerusalem have spread godlessness
        throughout the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth says:
Don’t listen to what the prophets are saying to you.
    They fill you with false hope.
        They speak about visions that they dreamed up.
        These visions are not from Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They keep saying to those who despise me,
    “Yahweh says, ‘Everything will go well for you.’”
    They tell all who live by their own stubborn ways,
        “Nothing bad will happen to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is in Yahweh’s inner circle
    and sees and hears his word?
    Who pays attention and listens to his word?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The storm of Yahweh will come with his anger.
    Like a windstorm, it will swirl down on the heads of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The anger of Yahweh will not turn back
    until he has done everything he intends to do.
    In the last days you will understand this clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I didn’t send these prophets,
    yet they ran with their message.
    I didn’t speak to them,
    yet they prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they had been in my inner circle,
    they would have announced my words to my people.
        They would have turned back from their evil ways
            and the evil they have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I am an Elohim who is near.
    I am also an Elohim who is far away,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“No one can hide so that I can’t see him,” declares Yahweh.
    “I fill heaven and earth!” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’ve heard the prophets who speak lies in my name. They say, ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long will these prophets continue to lie and deceive?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tell each other the dreams they had, because they want to make my people forget my name, as their ancestors forgot my name because of Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet who has a dream should tell his dream. However, the person who has my word should honestly speak my word. What does grain have to do with straw?” asks Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Isn’t my word like fire or like a hammer that shatters a rock?” asks Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m against the prophets who steal my words from each other,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I’m against the prophets who speak their own thoughts and say that they speak for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m against those who prophesy dreams they made up,” declares Yahweh. “They tell the dreams they made up and lead my people astray with their lies and their wild talk. I didn’t send them or command them to go. They don’t help these people at all,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When these people, the prophets, or the priests ask you, ‘What revelation has Yahweh burdened you with now?’ say to them, ‘You are the burden! I will abandon you, declares Yahweh.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose the prophets, the priests, or these people say, ‘This is Yahweh’s revelation!’ I will punish them and their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They should ask their neighbors and their relatives, ‘What is Yahweh’s answer?’ and ‘What did Yahweh say?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They should never again say, ‘This is Yahweh’s revelation,’ because each person’s word becomes the revelation. They will twist the words of Elohim Chay, Yahweh Tsebaoth, our Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Jeremiah, say this to the prophets, ‘What was Yahweh’s answer to you?’ and ‘What did Yahweh say?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose they say, ‘This is Yahweh’s revelation!’ Then say, ‘This is what Yahweh says: Because you have said, “This is Yahweh’s revelation!” even though I commanded you not to repeat this saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will certainly forget you. I will throw you out of my presence and out of the city that I gave you and your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring eternal disgrace and shame on you. It will never be forgotten.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon took Jehoiakin (son of King Jehoiakim of Judah), the princes of Judah, the skilled workers, and the builders from Jerusalem into captivity and brought them to Babylon. After this, Yahweh showed me two baskets of figs set in front of Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like figs that ripen first. The other basket had very bad figs. These figs were so bad that they couldn’t be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Yahweh asked me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?”
I answered, “Figs. Figs that are very good. I also see figs that are very bad, so bad that they can’t be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Yahweh Elohim of Israel says: The captives of Judah, whom I sent away from here to Babylon, are like these good figs. I will look kindly on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will watch over them for their own good, and I will bring them back to this land. I will build them up and not tear them down. I will plant them and not uproot them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them the desire to know that I am Yahweh. They will be my people, and I will be their Elohim, because they will wholeheartedly come back to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But this is what the Lord says about the bad figs that are so bad that they can’t be eaten. Yahweh says, ‘Like these bad figs, I will abandon King Zedekiah of Judah, his princes, the remaining few in Jerusalem who stayed behind in this land, and those who are living in Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them a horrifying sight to all the kingdoms of the earth. They will be a disgrace and an example. They will become something ridiculed and cursed wherever I scatter them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send wars, famines, and plagues until they disappear from the land that I gave to them and their ancestors.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah about all the people of Judah when Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, was in his fourth year as king. (This was the first year that Nebuchadnezzar was king of Babylon.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet Jeremiah spoke to all the people of Judah and to everyone who lived in Jerusalem. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For 23 years, from the time that Josiah, son of Amon, was in his thirteenth year as king of Judah until today, Yahweh continued to speak his word to me. So I have spoken to you again and again, but you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Even though Yahweh has sent all his servants the prophets to you, you haven’t listened or paid attention to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets said, ‘Turn from your evil ways and the evil you have done, and live in the land that Yahweh permanently gave to you and your ancestors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t follow other gods to serve and worship them. Don’t make me furious about the idols your hands have shaped. Then I won’t harm you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you haven’t listened to me, declares Yahweh. You have made me furious about the idols your hands have shaped and have brought harm upon yourselves.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth says: You did not listen to my words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so I’m going to send for all the families from the north. I will also send for my servant King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, declares Yahweh. I will bring the families from the north to attack this land, its people, and all these surrounding nations. I’m going to destroy them and turn them into something terrible, something ridiculed, and something permanently ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will take from them the sounds of joy and happiness, the sounds of brides and grooms, the sound of mills, and the light of lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This whole land will be ruined and become a wasteland. These nations will serve the king of Babylon for 70 years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the 70 years are over, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation for their crimes, declares Yahweh. I will turn Babylon into a permanent wasteland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring on that land all the disasters I threatened to do to it, everything that Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations, everything written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many nations and great kings will make slaves of the people of Babylon, and I will pay them back for what they have done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh Elohim of Israel said to me: Take from my hand this cup filled with the wine of my fury, and make all the nations to whom I’m sending you drink from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they drink from it, they will stagger and go insane because of the wars that I’m going to send them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the cup from Yahweh’s hand. I made all the nations to whom Yahweh sent me drink from it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem and the cities of Judah as well as its kings and officials. When they drank from it, they became wastelands and ruins, something ridiculed and cursed, until today.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also made these people drink from it: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, officials, all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the foreign people living among them; all the kings of the land of Uz; all the kings of Philistia, those from the cities of Ashkelon, Gaza, and Ekron, and the people left in Ashdod;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, Moab, and the people of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Tyre and Sidon, and the kings on the seacoast;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who shave the hair on their foreheads;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the foreign people living in the desert;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of Media;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of the north, near and far, one after another—all the kingdoms of the earth. Last of all, the king of Sheshach will drink from the cup.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Say to them, ‘This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: Drink, get drunk, vomit, fall down, and don’t get up because of the wars that I’m going to send you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink from it, say to them, ‘This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth says: You must drink from it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am going to bring disaster on the city that is named after me. Do you think you’ll go unpunished? You will not go unpunished! I’m declaring war on all those who live on earth, declares Yahweh Tsebaoth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“That is why you will prophesy all these things to them and say,
‘Yahweh roars from above.
    He thunders from his holy dwelling place.
    He roars against his land.
    He shouts like those who stomp grapes.
    He shouts against all those who live on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound is echoing to the ends of the earth
    because Yahweh has brought charges against the nations.
    He will judge all humans.
    He will kill the wicked, declares Yahweh.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth says:
Disaster is spreading from nation to nation.
    A great storm is brewing from the distant corners of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day those killed by Yahweh will stretch from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be mourned, taken away, or buried. They will become like manure on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mourn, you shepherds, and cry.
    Roll in the dust, you leaders of the flock.
    The time has come for you to be slaughtered.
    The time has come for you to be scattered,
        and you will break like fine pottery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will be no place for the shepherds to flee,
    no escape for the leaders of the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The shepherds are crying
    and the leaders of the flock are mourning
        because Yahweh is stripping their pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The peaceful pastures are destroyed by Yahweh’s burning anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has left his lair like a lion.
    Their land has been ruined
        because of the heat of the oppressor,
        because of the fury of his anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word when Judah’s King Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, began to rule. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Yahweh says: Stand in the courtyard of Yahweh’s temple, and speak to all the people who come from the cities of Judah to worship in Yahweh’s temple. Tell them everything that I command you to tell them. Don’t leave out a single word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maybe they’ll listen, and they’ll turn from their evil ways. Then I’ll change my plan about the disaster I intend to bring on them because of the evil they have done.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord added, “Also say to them, ‘This is what Yahweh says: Suppose you don’t listen to me and don’t follow my teachings that I set in front of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Suppose you don’t listen to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I sent to you again and again, even though you didn’t listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will do to this temple what I did to Shiloh. I will turn this city into something that will be cursed by all the nations on earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests, the prophets, and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these things in Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as soon as Jeremiah finished saying everything that Yahweh had commanded him to say, the priests, the prophets, and all the people grabbed him and said, “You must die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you prophesy in Yahweh’s name that this temple will be like Shiloh and this city will become a pile of rubble with no one living here?” Then all the people crowded around Jeremiah in Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officials of Judah heard about these things, they went from the king’s palace to Yahweh’s temple. They sat at the entrance of New Gate to Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests and the prophets said to the officials and all the people, “This man is condemned to die because he prophesied against this city as you yourselves have heard.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to all the officials and all the people, “Yahweh sent me to prophesy everything that you have heard me say against this temple and against this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, change your ways and what you are doing, and listen to Yahweh your Elohim. Then Yahweh will change his plan about the disaster that he intends to bring on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My life is in your hands. Do with me whatever you think is good and right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But know for certain that if you put me to death, you, this city, and the people living in it will be guilty of killing an innocent person. Yahweh has certainly sent me to speak all these things to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and prophets, “This man should not be condemned to die. He has spoken to us in the name of Yahweh our Elohim.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the leaders in the land got up and said to the entire crowd,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Micah from Moresheth prophesied at the time of Judah’s King Hezekiah and said to all the people of Judah, ‘This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth says:
Zion will be plowed like a field,
    Jerusalem will become a pile of rubble,
        and the temple mountain will become a worship site
            covered with trees.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did Judah’s King Hezekiah and all the people of Judah put Micah to death? No! Hezekiah feared Yahweh and sought Yahweh’s favor. So Yahweh changed his plan about the disaster he intended to bring on them. But we are about to bring a bigger disaster on ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was another man prophesying in the name of Yahweh. His name was Uriah, son of Shemaiah, from Kiriath Jearim. He prophesied against this city and this land as Jeremiah did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Jehoiakim and all his personal troops and officials heard what Uriah said, the king wanted to put him to death. But Uriah heard about it and fled in fear to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Jehoiakim sent soldiers to Egypt: Elnathan (son of Achbor) and other soldiers along with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought Uriah from Egypt and took him to King Jehoiakim. The king executed Uriah and threw his body into the burial ground for the common people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahikam, son of Shaphan, supported Jeremiah. So Jeremiah was not handed over to the people to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Zedekiah, son of King Josiah of Judah, began to rule, Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh said to me: Make leather straps and a wooden yoke, and strap the yoke on your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then send messages to the kings of Edom, Moab, Ammon, Tyre, and Sidon, with messengers who have come to King Zedekiah of Judah in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give them an order for their masters: “This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: Say this to your masters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I used my great strength and my powerful arm to make the earth along with the people and the animals on it. I give it to anyone I please.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have handed all these countries over to my servant King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon. I have even made wild animals serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All nations will serve him, his son, and his grandson until Babylon is defeated. Then many nations and great kings will make him their slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Suppose nations or kingdoms won’t serve or surrender to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon. I will punish those nations by wars, famines, and plagues, until I have put an end to them by Nebuchadnezzar’s power, declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t listen to prophets, mediums, interpreters of dreams, fortunetellers, or sorcerers who tell you that you’ll never serve the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are prophesying lies to you. They will cause you to be taken far from your lands. I’ll scatter you, and you will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But suppose a nation surrenders to the king of Babylon and serves him. I will let it stay in its own land. People will farm the land and live on it,’” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I spoke the same message to King Zedekiah of Judah, “Surrender to the king of Babylon, serve him and his people, and you will stay alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should you and your people die in wars, famines, and plagues? Yahweh has threatened the nations that don’t serve the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t listen to the prophets who tell you that you’ll never serve the king of Babylon. They are prophesying lies to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I didn’t send them, declares Yahweh. They prophesy lies in my name. So I will scatter you, and you and the prophets will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also spoke this message to the priests and all the people. “This is what Yahweh said to me: Don’t listen to the prophets who tell you that the utensils of Yahweh’s temple will be brought back from Babylon soon. They are prophesying lies to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t listen to them. Instead, serve the king of Babylon, and live. Why should this city be turned into rubble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they are prophets and Yahweh is speaking to them, they should beg Yahweh Tsebaoth not to allow the utensils that are left in Yahweh’s temple, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem to be taken away to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: –“Babylon’s King Nebuchadnezzar took Jehoiakin, son of King Jehoiakim of Judah, into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem. But he didn’t take the pillars, the bronze pool, the stands, and the rest of the utensils that are left in this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says about the utensils that are left in Yahweh’s temple, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will be taken to Babylon and stay there until I come for them, declares Yahweh. I will take them from there and bring them back to this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same year, early in the rule of King Zedekiah of Judah, in the fifth month of his fourth year as king, the prophet Hananiah, son of Azzur, from Gibeon, spoke to me in Yahweh’s temple. He said to me in front of the priests and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within two years I will bring back all the utensils of Yahweh’s temple that King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon took from this place and carried off to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also bring back to this place Jehoiakin, son of King Jehoiakim of Judah, and all the captives of Judah who went to Babylon, declares Yahweh. So I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet Jeremiah replied to the prophet Hananiah in front of the priests and all the people standing in Yahweh’s temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “Amen! May Yahweh do this! May Yahweh make your prophecy come true and bring back the utensils of Yahweh’s temple and all the captives from Babylon to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now listen to this message that I am speaking to you and to all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Long ago, the prophets who preceded you and me prophesied wars, disasters, and plagues against many countries and great kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the prophet who prophesied peace was recognized as a prophet that Yahweh sent only if the message of the prophet came true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Hananiah took the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah and broke it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hananiah said in front of all the people, “This is what Yahweh says: In the same way, I will break the yoke of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon off the neck of all the nations within two years.” Then the prophet Jeremiah went on his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the prophet Hananiah broke the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah, Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Hananiah, ‘This is what Yahweh says: You have broken the wooden yoke, but I will replace it with an iron yoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: I will put an iron yoke on the necks of all these nations so that they will serve King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon. They will serve him! I will even make wild animals serve him.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah told the prophet Hananiah, “Now listen, Hananiah, Yahweh hasn’t sent you. You have made these people believe a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: I’m going to remove you from the face of the earth. You will die this year because you have encouraged rebellion against Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the prophet Hananiah died in the seventh month of that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophet Jeremiah sent a letter from Jerusalem to the rest of the leaders among the captives. He also sent it to the priests, the prophets, and all the people that Nebuchadnezzar took away as captives from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This was after King Jehoiakin and his mother, the court officials, the leaders of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and metal workers left Jerusalem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent the letter with Shaphan’s son Elasah and Hilkiah’s son Gemariah, whom King Zedekiah of Judah had sent to King Nebuchadnezzar in Babylon. The letter said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says to all those who were taken captive from Jerusalem to Babylon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build houses, and live in them. Plant gardens, and eat what they produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Get married, and have sons and daughters. Find wives for your sons, and let your daughters get married so that they can have sons and daughters. Grow in number there; don’t decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Work for the good of the city where I’ve taken you as captives, and pray to Yahweh for that city. When it prospers, you will also prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: Don’t let the prophets or the mediums who are among you trick you. Don’t even listen to your own dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people are prophesying lies to you in my name. I didn’t send them, declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: When Babylon’s 70 years are over, I will come to you. I will keep my promise to you and bring you back to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know the plans that I have for you, declares Yahweh. They are plans for peace and not disaster, plans to give you a future filled with hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will call to me. You will come and pray to me, and I will hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you look for me, you will find me. When you wholeheartedly seek me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will let you find me, declares Yahweh. I will bring you back from captivity. I will gather you from all the nations and places where I’ve scattered you, declares Yahweh. I will bring you back from the place where you are being held captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You’ve said that Yahweh has given you prophets in Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is what Yahweh says about the king who sits on David’s throne and about all the people who live in this city, the people who are your relatives and who weren’t taken away as captives:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh Tsebaoth says: I’m going to send them wars, famines, and plagues. These people are like rotten figs to me, figs that are so bad that they can’t be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will chase them with wars, famines, and plagues. I will make them a horrifying sight to all the kingdoms on the earth. They will become something cursed, ridiculed, and hissed at, and they will be a disgrace among all the nations where I scatter them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They didn’t listen to me, declares Yahweh. I sent them my servants the prophets again and again, but they refused to listen, declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So listen to the word of Yahweh, all you captives who were sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says about Kolaiah’s son Ahab and about Maaseiah’s son Zedekiah, who prophesy lies to you in my name: I’m going to hand them over to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon. I will kill them as you watch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of them, all the captives from Judah who are in Babylon will use this curse: May Yahweh curse you as he cursed Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon burned to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have done shameful things in Israel. They committed adultery with their neighbors’ wives and spoke lies in my name. I didn’t command them to do this. I know what they have done. I’m a witness, declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord says, “Say to Shemaiah from Nehelam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: You sent letters in your own name to all the people who are in Jerusalem, to the priest Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah, and to all the priests. These letters said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh made you priest instead of Jehoiada so that there would be officials for Yahweh’s temple. You should put any lunatic who acts like a prophet in prison and in shackles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, why haven’t you arrested Jeremiah from Anathoth? After all, he acts like a prophet among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why Jeremiah sent this message to us in Babylon: You will be captives a long time. Build houses, and live in them. Plant gardens, and eat what they produce.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest Zephaniah read this letter to the prophet Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send this message to all the captives: ‘This is what Yahweh says about Shemaiah from Nehelam: Shemaiah prophesied to you, but I didn’t send him. He has made you believe a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh says: I will punish Shemaiah from Nehelam. I will also punish his descendants. No one from his family will be left alive. He will not see the blessings that I’m going to send my people, declares Yahweh, because he has encouraged rebellion against Yahweh.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what Yahweh Elohim of Israel says: Write in a book everything that I tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days are coming,” declares Yahweh, “when I will bring my people Israel and Judah back from captivity. I will bring them back to the land that I gave their ancestors, and they will take possession of it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the message that Yahweh spoke about Israel and Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what Yahweh says:
“We hear cries of fear, cries of panic, not cries of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ask now, and see: Can a man give birth to a child?
    Why, then, do I see every strong man holding his stomach in pain
        like a woman giving birth to a child?
        Why has every face turned pale?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How terrible that day will be!
    There will be no other day like it.
        It will be a time of calamity for the descendants of Jacob,
            but they will be rescued from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On that day,” declares Yahweh Tsebaoth, “I will break the yokes off your necks and tear off your ropes. Foreigners will no longer make you serve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will serve Yahweh your Elohim and David your king. I will establish him for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Don’t be afraid, my servant Jacob,” declares Yahweh.
    Don’t be terrified, Israel.
    I’m going to rescue you from a faraway place.
    I’m going to rescue your descendants from where they are captives.
        The descendants of Jacob will again have peace and security,
            and no one will frighten them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am with you, and I will rescue you,” declares Yahweh.
    “I will completely destroy all the nations where I scattered you,
    but I will not completely destroy you.
        I will correct you with justice.
            I won’t let you go entirely unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what Yahweh says:
Your wound is incurable.
    Your injury is beyond healing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No one argues that you should be healed.
    No medicine will heal you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All your lovers have forgotten you,
    and they don’t want you anymore.
    I’ve punished you as an enemy would.
    I’ve corrected you as a cruel person would.
    You are very wicked, and you have many sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you cry about your wound, your injury that can’t be cured?
    I’ve done this to you.
    You are very wicked, and you have many sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why everyone who devours you will be devoured,
    and all your enemies will be taken away as captives.
    Those who looted you will be looted.
    Those who stole from you in war will have things stolen from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I’ll restore your health and heal your wounds,” declares Yahweh.
    “People call you an outcast:
        Zion, no one cares for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is what Yahweh says:
I’m going to bring the captives back to Jacob’s tents
    and show compassion on their homes.
    Cities will be built on the ruins,
    and fortified palaces will be built in their rightful place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people who live there will sing songs of praise,
    and the sound of laughter will be heard from there.
    I’ll make them numerous, and their number won’t decrease.
    I’ll bring them honor, and they won’t be considered unimportant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their children will be like they were long ago.
    Their community will be established in my presence,
    and I will punish everyone who oppresses them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their leader will be someone from their own people.
    Their ruler will come from among them.
    I’ll bring him near, and he will come close to me.
        Who would dare to come near me?” asks Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be my people, and I will be your Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The storm of Yahweh will come with his anger.
    Like a driving wind, it will swirl down on the heads of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh’s burning anger will not turn back
    until he has done everything he intends to do.
        In the last days you will understand this clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time,” declares Yahweh, “I will be the Elohim of all the families of Israel, and they will be my people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
The people who survived the wars have found favor in the desert.
    Israel went to find its rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh appeared to me in a faraway place and said,
“I love you with an everlasting love.
    So I will continue to show you my kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once again I will build you up,
            and you will be rebuilt, my dear people Israel.
        Once again you will take your tambourines,
            and you will go dancing with happy people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once again you will plant vineyards on the mountains of Samaria.
            Those who plant them will enjoy the fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will be a day when watchmen on the mountains of Ephraim
    will call out this message:
        ‘Arise! Let’s go to Zion, to Yahweh our Elohim.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
Sing a happy song about Jacob.
    Sing joyfully for the leader of the nations.
    Shout, sing praise, and say,
    “O Yahweh, rescue your people, the remaining few from Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will bring them from the land of the north.
    I will gather them from the farthest parts of the earth.
    Blind people and lame people will return
        together with pregnant women and those in labor.
            A large crowd will return here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will cry as they return.
    They will pray as I bring them back.
    I will lead them beside streams
    on a level path where they will not stumble.
        I will be an Ab to Israel,
            and Ephraim will be my firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You nations, listen to the word of Yahweh.
    Tell it to the distant islands.
    Say, ‘The one who scattered the people of Israel will gather them
        and watch over them as a shepherd watches over his flock.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh will free the descendants of Jacob
    and reclaim them from those who are stronger than they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will come and shout for joy on top of Mount Zion.
    They will stream to it to enjoy Yahweh’s blessings:
        fresh grain, new wine, and olive oil, lambs and calves.
    Their lives will be like well-watered gardens,
        and they will never suffer again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then young women will rejoice and dance
    along with young men and old men.
    I will turn their mourning into joy.
    I will comfort them.
    I will give them joy in place of their sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will satisfy the priests with rich food.
    My people will be filled with my blessings,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
A sound is heard in Ramah,
    the sound of crying in bitter grief.
        Rachel is crying for her children.
            She refuses to be comforted,
                because they are dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
Stop your crying, and wipe away your tears.
    You will be rewarded for your work, declares Yahweh.
    You will return from the land of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your future is filled with hope, declares Yahweh.
    Your children will return to their own territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have certainly heard Ephraim mourn and say,
    ‘You disciplined me, and I was disciplined.
        I was like a young, untrained calf.
    Turn me, and I will be turned,
        because you are Yahweh my Elohim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After I was turned around, I changed the way I thought and acted.
    After I was taught a lesson, I hung my head in shame.
    I was so ashamed and humiliated,
        because of all the stupid things I have done
            ever since I was young.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is Ephraim my dear son? Is he a pleasant child?
    Even though I have often spoken against him, I still think fondly of him.
    That is why my heart longs for him,
        and I will certainly have compassion on him,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Set up landmarks!
    Put up road signs!
    Remember the highway, the road on which you traveled.
    Come back, my dear people Israel, come back to your cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you wander around, you unfaithful people?
    Yahweh will create something new on earth:
    A woman will protect a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: When I have brought them back from captivity, they will once again use this saying in Judah and in its cities:
“Yahweh bless you, home of righteousness, holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judah and all its cities will live there together.
    Farmers and shepherds will also live there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give those who are weary all they need.
    I will refresh everyone who is filled with sorrow.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this, I woke up and looked around. My sleep had been pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The days are coming,” declares Yahweh, “when I will plant the nations of Israel and Judah with people and animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once I watched over them to uproot them, to tear them down, and to wreck, ruin, and hurt them. Now I will watch over them to build them up and to plant them,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When those days come, people will no longer say, ‘Fathers have eaten sour grapes, and their children’s teeth are set on edge.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But each person will die for his own sin. Whoever eats sour grapes will have his own teeth set on edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The days are coming,” declares Yahweh, “when I will make a new promise to Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will not be like the promise that I made to their ancestors when I took them by the hand and brought them out of Egypt. They rejected that promise, although I was a husband to them,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But this is the promise that I will make to Israel after those days,” declares Yahweh: “I will put my teachings inside them, and I will write those teachings on their hearts. I will be their Elohim, and they will be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No longer will each person teach his neighbors or his relatives by saying, ‘Know Yahweh.’ All of them, from the least important to the most important, will know me,” declares Yahweh, “because I will forgive their wickedness and I will no longer hold their sins against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh provides the sun to be a light during the day.
    He orders the moon and stars to be lights during the night.
    He stirs up the sea so that its waves roar.
        His name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.
This is what Yahweh says:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only if these laws stop working, declares Yahweh,
    will Israel’s descendants stop being a nation in my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what Yahweh says:
Only if the heavens could be measured
    or the foundations of the earth could be searched,
        would I ever reject all of Israel’s descendants
            because of everything that they have done, declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The days are coming,” declares Yahweh, “when the city will be rebuilt for Yahweh from the Tower of Hananel to Corner Gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A measuring line will stretch from there straight to the Hill of Gareb, and then it will turn to Goah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole valley, filled with its dead bodies and ashes, and the whole area to the Kidron Valley, as far as the corner of Horse Gate in the east, will be holy to Yahweh. It will never be uprooted or torn down again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah during Zedekiah’s tenth year as king of Judah. (This was Nebuchadnezzar’s eighteenth year as king.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At that time the army of the king of Babylon was blockading Jerusalem.
The prophet Jeremiah was locked up in the courtyard of the prison. This prison was in the palace of the king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When King Zedekiah of Judah locked up Jeremiah, Zedekiah asked him, “Why are you prophesying? You are saying, ‘This is what Yahweh says: I’m going to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Zedekiah of Judah will not escape from the Babylonians. He will certainly be handed over to the king of Babylon. He will talk to Nebuchadnezzar in person and look him in the eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebuchadnezzar will take Zedekiah to Babylon, and Zedekiah will stay there until I deal with him, declares Yahweh. When you fight the Babylonians, you won’t win.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said, “Yahweh spoke his word to me. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Jeremiah, your cousin Hanamel, son of Shallum, is going to come to you and say, “Buy my field that is in Anathoth, because as the closest relative it is your responsibility to buy it.” ’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then, as Yahweh had said, my cousin Hanamel came to me in the courtyard of the prison. He said to me, ‘Please buy my field that is in Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin. It is your responsibility to purchase it, because the rights of the closest relative belong to you. Buy it for yourself.’ Then I knew that Yahweh had spoken to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So I bought the field in Anathoth from my cousin Hanamel and gave him the money. The field cost seven ounces of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I signed the deed, sealed it, had people witness the signing of the deed, and paid out the silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the sealed copy of the deed, containing the terms and conditions, as well as an unsealed copy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave the copies of the deeds to Baruch, son of Neriah and grandson of Mahseiah. I did this in the presence of my cousin Hanamel and the witnesses who had signed the deed and in the presence of all the Jews who were sitting in the courtyard of the prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I gave Baruch these orders:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: Take both of these documents, both the sealed and the unsealed copies of the deed. Put them in a clay jar so that they will last a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh Tsebaoth, the Elohim of Israel, says: My people will again buy houses, fields, and vineyards in this land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After I had given the copies to Baruch, son of Neriah, I prayed to Yahweh. I prayed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Adonay Yahweh, you made heaven and earth by your great strength and powerful arm. Nothing is too hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show mercy to thousands of generations. However, you punish children for the wickedness of their parents. You, El, are great and mighty. Your name is Yahweh Tsebaoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You make wise plans and do mighty things. You see everything the descendants of Adam do. You reward them for the way they live and for what they do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You performed miraculous signs and amazing things in Egypt. To this day you are still doing them in Israel. You made a name for yourself that continues to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You brought your people from Egypt with miraculous signs and amazing things, with a mighty hand and a powerful arm, and with great terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You gave them the land that you swore with an oath to give their ancestors, the land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They entered and took possession of it. However, they refused to obey you or to follow your teachings. They didn’t do anything you commanded them to do, so you brought all this disaster on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘See how the dirt ramps have been built up around the city to capture it! Because of wars, famines, and plagues, the city will be handed over to the Babylonians who are attacking it. What you have threatened to do has happened, as you can see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you, Adonay Yahweh, told me to buy a field with money and get witnesses to confirm it, although the city was handed over to the Babylonians.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke his word to Jeremiah. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am Yahweh Elohim of all humanity. Nothing is too hard for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what Yahweh says: I’m going to hand this city over to the Babylonians and King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon. They will capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Babylonians who are attacking this city will break in, set this city on fire, and burn it down. They will burn down the houses of people who made me furious by going up to the roofs to burn incense to Baal and to pour out wine offerings to other gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ever since they were young, the people of Israel and Judah have done what I consider evil. The people of Israel have made me furious by what they’ve done,” declares Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The people in this city have made me so angry and furious from the day they built it to this day. So now I must remove this city from my presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The people of Israel and Judah have made me furious because they are evil. The people, their kings and officials, their priests and prophets, and the Judeans and those who live in Jerusalem
